newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MRCB group shares firmer on requote.
newsitem.headline: MRCB group shares firmer on requote.

text.p: Shares of media conglomerate Malaysian Resources Corp Bhd (MRCB) and its associates were firmer after being requoted on Wednesday after having been suspended since last Thursday.

MRCB opened at 10.10 ringgit against its closing price of 9.80 ringgit, Sistem Televisyen Malaysia Bhd (TV3) rose five cents to 5.85, while New Straits Times Press Bhd was unchanged at its last closing price of 15.20.
The shares had been suspended for an announcement of a reshuffling of assets within the group.

Under the restructuring exercise announced on Tuesday, MRCB will eventually hold an 82.2 percent stake in private television operator TV3, which will in turn, indirectly own 43.7 percent of newspaper publisher New Straits Times Press.
Currently MRCB, which also proposed to make a bonus issue of one-for-three basis, owns 45.1 percent of TV3 and 43.7 percent of NSTP.
